website_summaries.verdict: A mid-level electric-powered model that comes at a mid-range price. The stand that comes with it is an added bonus that makes it more convenient to operate.
pros: Can be used with or without the 34-inch stand that comes with it
Falls on the middle of the price spectrum
cons: Awkward to try to use without two hands
Not suitable for extremely heavy-duty tasks

website_summaries.verdict: WEN's electric 6.5-ton log splitter is a versatile machine that can be used on the ground or on a raised stand (34 inches tall).
pros: The unit can split logs up to 10-inches in diameter that are 20.5 inches long
At only 100 pounds, the 5-inch never-flat wheels make this durable machine highly portable
Additionally, you can quickly set the push plate's travel distance with the convenient ram-limiting adjustment
cons: When moving the unit into a raised position, you will need help because it is a two (or more) man job

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate! Ah-mazing!
customer_reviews.text: We finally decided to buy a splitter after several years of doing it by hand, and wow was it worth it! This thing is a little tank! In the pictures, we have a 16" diameter round of cedar that it split with ease. The only time it got bound up was when we had a knot right where it was splitting, and all we had to do was flip the log around, and it had no issue. We have split 2 cords or so with it already... it makes life so easy! The stand is a back saver too. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I put the biggest nastiest (non-knotty) piece of red oak on it I could find and it busted right on through it without a struggle. I wasnt able to split those with a splitting maul but this splitter got on through it. I had over 100lbs of weight on it and it didnt flinch. Splitter itself is probably 100lbs. I'll come back when I find a more difficult piece
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great for a weekend...
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of Hickory which is very knotty and hard to chop. I bought this hoping that it would speed things up. Once i learned that if it doesn't go through a log the first time to just rotate it 90 degrees and try again it really worked. The issue was on the second day it started leaking hydraulic fluid so I'm guessing one of the seals gave way. I opened the air release valve before I used it every time so I don't know if I received a faulty one or the hickory was just too much for it.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Log splitter
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. 1 load down so far. Will split hard wood with some patients. The bad: the two handed operation is great for a 10 year old. Makes it troublesome to steady a log and run the machine. The ram comes up a little short. Would be nice if shoved a little closer to the wedge. Last the package was nearly destroyed some the bolts was missing. But it sure beats swinging a maul.
customer_reviews.author: john smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the $$
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this log splitter. It was perfect for my application. I was able to split about 2 cords of straight pine and oak over the course of 2 afternoons taking my time. The pine had already aged about 9 months and the oak was very old. It split it all with no problem. I could see people having issues with very large and/or fresh cut logs. Even when splitting by hand I've always let my wood age for at least 6 months before splitting. As long as you understand what your getting this is a great tool for the price. I already have several family members asking to borrow and possibly buy their own.
customer_reviews.author: shockopotamus

customer_reviews.title: Delivered and setup today. The only complaint I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered and setup today. The only complaint I have, is that the bolt heads to attached the stand to the splitter are not quite all the same size (1⁄2 inch). I assume these are cast, then threaded, so it's plausible that the heads may not be exactly the same size. I dealt with it, not a major pain. The splitter works very well, though and the stand makes it easier to work with.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Splits well, needs a little more. Its a nice splitter, however it came with the breaker wired to the neutral, rendering the breaker useless. Also needed to wire a switch in so i can have it continuously running to add a foot switch. Its difficult to split large logs while balancing and using both hands to operate controls. The high stand is great for working at waist level but is not easily disassembled for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Review

customer_reviews.title: Fair power but not $1100
customer_reviews.text: I had a large quantity of wood to split that I was slowly working through with a maul and sledge hammer. Decided to save my back and get a splitter. Originally considered gas, but storage is a huge consideration. Also, this unit was literally one fourth the price of the gas unit I was looking at. As far as storage, this has a smaller footprint in my shed than my lawn mower. Power was sufficient to clear my entire stack minus a few that were too knotty. Log diameter of a freshly felled maple was maybe 10-12" and it had no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice little splitter powerful
customer_reviews.text: So far this log splitter is working GREAT. We wish is had better wheels and my husband will be doing something about that soon, but for not it’ll do. The wheels are just pretty much useless in the dirt or gravel but, they are just fine if you are using it on concrete or asphalt. We have been using it to split juniper and it’s doing a decent job. It readily handles uniform shaped logs. It’s not quite as happy with addle shaped pieces but, you can work with it. For an electric splitter it’s really powerful and well made. We feel it is priced quite well for what you are getting.
customer_reviews.author: TAMMY L NORRBOM

customer_reviews.title: Good till it stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Great small log splitter until it stopped being able to split logs. I have had this unit just long enough to be past return window, but not even 2 months yet. Only used it about 4 times and on the 4th I was no longer able to split logs. The ram moves very slowly now and can’t build enough pressure to split anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to split logs at my cabin and it is working great. I like the stand, so I don't have to bend over while operating the splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Arrett

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in lack of power
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this. Received ours, set up the legs/stand and anxiously looked forward to splitting our red oak. The first 4" diameter log (with a slight crook) went very well. Slow, but well. Then we tried a very average 7" diameter log with a very mild knot and the splitting wedge hardly made a scratch on the end of the log. We were totally surprised and disgruntled. Tried another log of similar characteristics... same result. Totally shocked and surprised and will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing has power goes through what ever I throw at it
customer_reviews.author: Raymann

customer_reviews.title: Was shocked , but in a good way.
customer_reviews.text: The shipper did his best to beat it up but it still worked after a bit of repair. They smashed the fan guard into the fan and it popped the breaker a few times before I figured it out. I think it would be better if the ram came closer to the splitter but with a little stump I made that happen. This splitter took on some of the most twisted stumps/trunks with ease. Was very happy I didn't have to swing the maul. I don't think I would have made it thru the wood with a maul.
customer_reviews.author: crewofcats

customer_reviews.title: Beware of this splitter
customer_reviews.text: Set it up as per manual. 1st log split perfect. 2nd log a piece got stuck under Log Ram. Tried for an hour to get it loose, called WEN help number. 1st person had no idea what I was talking about, transferred me to Paul who said "this sometimes happens." "Do not remove the Log Ram, instead use a screwdriver & crow bar to work the stuck piece out." There is nothing in the manual about the Log Ram. After 4, yes 4 hours with the help of a neighbor it finally came out. The whole thing will be returned for a refund. YOU have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Bobber2015

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful tool!
customer_reviews.text: After using this to split a cord of firewood, I am sold! I love that it has the stand to make it taller. It did come with a broken plastic cover over the motor electrical box. Probably broken in shipping, it's a heavy beast! I sort of hoped it would easily switch from the ground mount to the higher mount for storage and such, but that is not the case. I tried using it on a 2200w peak power generator and it did not work. Tried it on a 4500w peak power and it ran perfectly. In case anyone else is trying to use in the boonies!
customer_reviews.author: Travis & Marisa Tramp

customer_reviews.title: WEN log splitter
customer_reviews.text: THis splitter has done everything from 12 in long to 18 in long and up to 14 inch round and I hae had no problem. The down sides are you need both hands to operater controls and sometimes you need another to hold the log in the right position. The other is it needs a handle on the front leg for ease of moving. It is realy hard to lift it high enough to roll it around. The third is the wheels could be bigger for ease of moving.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Very strong for what it is
customer_reviews.text: This thing has a surprising amount of power for a little 6 ton electric. It's a bit slow, but still better than swinging an axe. Make sure you follow the directions on the valve/vent thing or you could damage the hydraulics
customer_reviews.author: Nathan C. Marraffino

customer_reviews.title: Really like this little guy!
customer_reviews.text: Really went into this with low expectations. This little splitter really surprised me! I usually burn pine, red fir, and juniper. I tried splitting a gnarly piece of juniper that just bounced with my maul. This little splitter split it easily. Same thing with all the other crappy pieces I split. The big gas splitter we use handles all the great big pieces but for 12inch and smaller this is ideal. Can use easily in the shop, make kindling and just split at my leisure. Big fingers make it a little harder to put together but no big deal. I'm 66 years old and I would highly recommend this little guy. Your back will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: smitty3694

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Works for a few months on minor wood pieces and then shuts down. And THEN you get to deal with "Customer Service". Everything you just love with "Customer Service"... loads of invites to contact them with similing faces and lots of options... and NONE of them are useful. Called 5 times and placed on hold and then cut off. Wrote three times and got comupter answer that was a quote from the guide book. Sent it in for service and got laughed at by the pros.... "Really... THIS is your 'log splitter'?" Oh, well. should have known... a small electric splitter is ok for a few months but lacks durability and not really useful for the long haul. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit

customer_reviews.title: It's a Beast
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of buying this as I was originally wanting a 20+ ton towable unit, but I am super happy I did. I didn't want to shell out $1k plus on a log splitter as I only need roughly 2 cords of split wood a year. This thing splits every thing I have thrown at it. Even split hedge (osage orange) no problem. The stand makes it super nice on my lower back as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Leeman

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: Overall machine works well ... used it for less than an hour just to test it. Electric motor had small dent due to shipping. The packing is fine for a pallet shipping but not for UPS. Assembly was simple but not easy due to having to put nuts and washers on bolts in very difficult tight spots. It requires ratcheting wrench. Install two bolts on wedge end that are most difficult to reach before the closer two due to difficulty getting tool in there if all four are in place. The hardware is not well explained and crtical part of the diagram is very small and not precise.
customer_reviews.author: 9 yards

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough the grandkids can help.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing and makes splitting wood fun. I have cut Two cords of wood before this review and it's unbelievable how nice it works. I even felt safe letting my granddaughter help, the controls are so safe in my opinion because you have to use both hands on the controls in order to make it work. I was able to let her help and not have to worry about her hands getting hurt. One hand to press the power button and hold it down to start the motor, the other hand operates the lever to engage the part that pushes the wood into the splitter. Don't forget to wear Safety glasses and gloves.
customer_reviews.author: R. Iser

customer_reviews.title: Top Bang-for-the-Buck Tool Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This little powerhouse has got to be in my lifetime top five in the bang-for-the-buck category. Powerful, quiet, and easy to use. I assembled mine upside down to alleviate the need to lift/hold/bolt. That method makes it an easy one person job. Very easy to upright when you finish assembly. Oil level was perfect from the factory, but if you want to check it lift it to a 45° angle and check the dip stick. I'll find a foot switch to replace the (Lawyer mandated) push button eventually converting it to one hand operation. This is money well spent. It splits hardwood effortlessly. Peace
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband, or should I say a toy and he was beyond excited and thrilled to get this log splitter. He put it together rather quickly with the help of my dad and I think split a whole tree in one day..he did say it went through the oil fast. Over all, he loves it and can't wait to chop down another tree to split the wood.
customer_reviews.author: squirt

customer_reviews.title: This thing will flat split some wood.
customer_reviews.text: This will flat get with the program. I have 2 issues though. The rounded push ram doesn't grip the logs and can cause the log to slip off if not perfectly flat. I would prefer some teeth on a flat surface. The other issue is the hydraulic bleeder valve. It is plastic and the logs will hit it and break off the wings on the valve. I got tired of regluing it. It works fine the way it is without the wings. Still five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Average Guy

customer_reviews.title: Verrrry Strong! Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This thing runs off of an extension cord and was cutting fresh oak rounds that were 20x20 no problem. Fast return to start position as well. I did not install the stand because of how heavy these logs were and it still was easy. I was easily able to wheel it around and pick it up to put in my back seat of the car. There could not be a more perfect and economical unit around if you have electricity. I am very glad I read all the reviews before picking this one and could not be happier. Don't forget!!! SEASON YOUR WOOD BEFORE BURNING IT INSIDE IF SO YOU DON'T END UP WITH A HOUSE FIRE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and powerful
customer_reviews.text: It showed up with package damaged and missing parts for legs. Called and reported. Amazon gave me a couple bucks off. Decided to keep because wasn't crazy about splitting up high. I like it better on ground. Have to say I love this thing. Live on 3 acres of woods. Always have trees down. For larger diameter I split in half by hand and do the rest with this. Works like a charm. Even had wife try one and she was impressed how easy it was. Plenty of wood for winter now.
customer_reviews.author: GDTRFB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing splitter!
customer_reviews.text: This splitter by far surpassed my expectations!!I was Leary to buy a smaller electric splitter but it was $1,000 cheaper then what I thought I needed. My wife said we should at least give it a chance and WOW!! it works great. You just have to be able to read the log and I was able to split a 25" diameter log. Works great!! The only bad thing was the bleed screw broke very easily and my complaint was responded to only once and nothing after 2 more emails. I bought the screw with the help from the parts list, that was included with the splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Tim and Amy Jo

customer_reviews.title: A pile of wood, reduced.
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this workhorse. Yes, the included guide is funny (my worthy foe was my son) and it is true that getting the back leg bolts on is tough. However, the pain of assembly was forgotten in a haze of sawdust, cracking wood, and a steadily increasing pile of burnable, proper-sized wood. As with any device, you will learn the correct size that your unit can handle and how best position the wood. Some logs are helped by a small cut at the top (use a chainsaw). Others you simply need to aim the blade at the weakest part. Well done. Massive time saver. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy R. Yee

customer_reviews.title: Great Mobile Splitter
customer_reviews.text: This wood splitter is extremely powerful and easily split logs I thought would not be possible with this machine. Out of 60 large logs (10-30 in diameter), only 3 required a different strategy to split, the other were split with ease. All that was required to split the 3 difficult logs was just aligning the log to split off edges until the log is, another person was required to hold the log at this angle, but it worked very well. I would recommend this splitter to anyone for home use, its a work horse!
customer_reviews.author: J. Samide

customer_reviews.title: if u wonder if it has power, it does!
customer_reviews.text: good power for a compact little log splitter. yea its not super quick but its pretty darn solid. i was able to split quite a few logs i couldnt split with my axe cuz they were to hard or to wet. this would load up a little bit and then BAM that log was done. i was ready to return it the minute i got it. even saved the box. tried it out right away on a good section of black walnut pieces and oak. burned the box the next day without a single regret. very good little machine for average trees.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Diederichs

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my mountain house
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my mountain house. It split everything I had. I will probably have to manually pre-split anything over 12" or so but I don't have much of that. I haven't found much use for the stand. I wish it could be folded under the unit so it is easier to attach and lift up to height. The unit is heavy and needs two people to get it up on the stand.
customer_reviews.author: David Park

customer_reviews.title: Great splitter for the price! Nothing else like it in this price range.
customer_reviews.text: With the help of a friend, I split around 5 face cords of oak with this splitter. This tool is amazing for the price. It is a little awkward to move around if you use the included stand. We tried it both with and without the stand. Without the stand it is much more stable and easier to move around on a dirt surface. With the stand, it is much easier on your back but more top heavy. If mine stopped working the next time I used it, I would buy another one exactly like it. I can't believe it survived everything I threw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Love it..
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, I was splitting giant green oak logs like nothing, very quiet, fairly easy to move. dislike - wish the tires were bigger to make it easier to move around, wish the height was adjustable, it's difficult to lift some of the big logs, also should have a foot pedal to free up one hand to hold log. Great value, been using it for about a month now, worked great even on tough oak logs
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool and quality! Impressive. One hint on assembly: turn unit upside down to attach legs and with the front single leg, use the bolts with the threads poking out for the nut. Otherwise, good luck! Not a good design. Same with the dual legs in back. Pita to do it per directions. Love the splitter!
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND
customer_reviews.text: I ran pieces of wood (Oak an Maple) up to 14-15" diameter and 2' long and it split every one of them with no problem. The only thing that SUCKS is that you have to push the button and move the level. Making it impossible to guide the wood or steady a misshaped piece. Overall I am crazy happy with how much easier this is than the ol maul. Stores easy, doesn't take up much space and cost 1/10th what a gas one cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E.

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse worth every penny and more
customer_reviews.text: It arrived missing the bolts to attach the stand but the instructions told me what kind/size I needed so I made a trip to the hardware and bought them. Even with that issue I still give 5 stars and would give 10 if it was possible. This little splitter is amazing and I dont say that often. BUY IT. You wont be sorry. It will do a 14 inch diameter log even though it says 10 max. Slices through oak like butter. Wet pine is not even an issue. This is the best bang for the buck I have ever gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Holben

customer_reviews.title: Not intended to do cords a cords of wood a season.
customer_reviews.text: For the money nice log splitter. Tires need to be rubber. That green button and lever you need to use when operating, makes it very annoying. I bought this just to crack kindling up and split bigger logs to fit my stove. I had a big gas one for doing cords of wood and by no means is this intended for that use. I think with a few modification this will be a great machine for what I need. Now time will have to go by to see if it last.
customer_reviews.author: Tugboat

customer_reviews.title: If you have to chop wood GET THIS!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES this wood splitter! He says its worth every penny he paid for it. Made well and so easy to use. Its like Santa brought him a wonderful new toy. We did not get this free or received any thing for our review. We just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybat2

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs!
customer_reviews.text: If you do small logs like me-no more than 12 inch long-then this is a great deal. Not hard to put it together and ready to go once you plug it in. Easy to use. The ring that limits the length it goes back is not very useful but I found I did not use it much anyway. It might do longer logs but I did not try it. Difficult logs with branch splits may not split with this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stout

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I got this for re-splitting wood not for bucking up new logs but the power is much better than anticipated. I had to change the fluid to Dextron for cold weather use, no problem, the fill could be bigger. This is a very powerful unit. I'm sure I'll split plenty of wood with. We'll see how it last. It was damaged in shipping, parts bent, etc but it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: jbhbill

customer_reviews.title: This little log splitter is great.
customer_reviews.text: This little log splitter is great. I have yet to run across the piece of wood it won't split. The stand puts it at a good height, just be gentle with it if you want it to last. I use a bungee cord to hold the lever down. You have to hold the lever up to get it to return, but it gives you a free hand to hold the log. (Don't do this if you aren't smart enough to keep your fingers out of the way.) Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: alaskakidz

customer_reviews.title: Never really thought it would work for me... Man was I wrong I love this little powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this years ago. Nice being able to split wood in the garage/shop. I split a little over a cord with it and I still cant believe it works so good. One thing I did not like was the button and lever you have to hold when splitting and no way to steady the wood. So I bought a foot switch (Linemaster 632-SC3 Clipper Foot Switch) and wired it in place of the button. Buy a used switch on line for around $20. I was splitting 8" to 10" around and 18" long Red Elm and Maple.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY J HURLEY JR

customer_reviews.title: Save your joints & buy this splitter.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of un-split cottonwood & needed a splitter to make it usable. This absolutely fit the bill. I have split nearly a cord of very large logs & it has backed off on only one of them and that just needed to be re-positioned. I have not attached it to the stand since some of the logs I'm splitting are too heavy for me to lift higher than the ground. I sit on a stump by the power controls & don't really need that stand.
customer_reviews.author: yellowcat

customer_reviews.title: Great splitter.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased because of the high reviews by various websites. The WEN 6.5 ton electric wood splitter was consistently in the top 3. Assembly of the stand was tricky but we'll worth it. Very easy on your back to operate when on the stand. Used the unit for 2 hours and it split seasoned red oak with no problem. Don't think I will be using the maul any more. So far, it's a great product and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Box was torn, but All Good to Go!
customer_reviews.text: We were Impressed on the spitting capabilty and overall speed. My son and I split cherry wood that was just cut a couple of months ago with ease. I also bought a 50 ft extension cord that is a15 amp so we could get closer to our wood pile. Log splitter is around 100 lbs, but it was fairly easy to move when it was assembled. Ergonomically friendly and saved our backs. Hydraulic fluid was checked and was good to go for us. Remember to read the instructions so you can see what needs to be done to bleed prior to splitting.
customer_reviews.author: TheShadyside

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I just needed to get a lot of wood split up before the Pacific Northwest rains came in. My rounds were as large as 24" in diameter. They were mostly seasoned fir, pine and cedar, but also contained some maple and alder. It did exactly what I needed, and never even groaned. I used to be a farm boy, but these days, I'm an old software engineer with a bad knee. Still, see for yourself what I was able to do by myself in a few hours. (Still sore from the lifting and stacking.) Exactly what I needed, and SO MUCH EASIER than what I did growing up using a sledge and wedge.
customer_reviews.author: slh

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and awkward to move. Wheels too small. Vert hard to pull across rough ground. Easy to pull across smooth surface. It will split wood. Wood much larger than it should. Two people can do damage to a wood pile.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Knight

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. A lot easier to handle than those big 20+ Ton monsters. Been able to split 12" sized rounds of Cherry Wood and Oak with no problem. I use it mainly to split the larger chunks I sometimes get when buying cords of wood. Even splits the chunks that have grain of branches growing out. Those are difficult with an axe!
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS THING!
customer_reviews.text: Fell in love with it as soon as I started using it. I was surprised to watch it go through some pretty healthy wood that I had just cut. The wood was wet, which got all over the machine. It is a bit hard to get to some of the places to clean that out. This, along with the WEN chainsaw, are the two best products I've bought for the farm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non-working machine gets 5-Stars.
customer_reviews.text: I used the machine on 2 occasions when it stopped working. I called product support and they talked me through "jumping" several of the components. I found that an insulated connector on one of the wires had gotten loose and was making contact intermittently. After making the repair to the switch and putting all the parts back together the machine went back to doing the quality job it had been doing prior to its break down. QUESTION: Would I buy it again? Yes, without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Connor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design.  Very effective.
customer_reviews.text: Similar style machine destroyed by recent flood, this was replacement. Same design, different company. Works great, splits wood effortlessly. Heavy to maneuver by hand. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carl M

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Cut down large oak tree in my yard and bought this in hopes that it would split the larger 6-10" pieces. It did not, but will try again after the wood seasons for a year. It did however do a great job of splitting some softer wood. I'll have plenty of opportunities to use this in the future, so I'm still happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent small log splitter. Extremely handy and splits everything i put on it . I'm so surprised at how strong it is. I have always used 27 to 32 ton gas splitters, but no more . This is all I will ever need. Thanks to the manufacture for such a good product at a very reasonable price. I HAVEN'T DONE REVIEWS BEFORE > This is my first. I just want you to know my opinion. Enjoy splitting !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boss Hogg

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should but damaged upon arrival.
customer_reviews.text: It will bog down once the log is more than about 6" across, but that's to be expected. It's a fine little splitter. Mine came damaged like so many others, but a call to the manufacturer and replacement parts were sent. Took an hour to install them, so yeah, the packaging needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.author: UserXYZ

customer_reviews.title: Broke after six months of low stress use.
customer_reviews.text: We split small pine logs for kindling only with this machine. It blew a seal after eight months of only once in a while use.. Waste of money. I bought one previously from Harbor Freight that lasted two years. I would never buy this product again. If I could leave zero stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: C. Philip Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent splitter
customer_reviews.text: It was not difficult to set up and I was surprised at how effective it is at splitting even large logs. The second time I used it, it seemed to be splitting slowly. I then discovered that it ships with just enough oil - probably to avoid spilling. I bought the oil and filled it and it has been going strong ever since.
customer_reviews.author: J. Natelle

customer_reviews.title: Great little splitter!
customer_reviews.text: Works well! I use it to make smaller splits for my smoker. Not for large logs by any means but will split logs 10 to 12 inches in diameter. Warning! Be careful with logs with alot of knots. Log may dislodge and become a projectile. Overall, it does the job intended and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, well built.
customer_reviews.text: Unit is very well built, nice stand if needed and splits logs much easier than I can. Upon assembly I saw the box said '2 people required'.... Right.. Well, USE 2 PEOPLE because the unit is top heavy and not easy to handle during assembly. Aside from my poor judgement the unit has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Old Techy

customer_reviews.title: Has great power for an electric model
customer_reviews.text: Used this to split some walnut trees we had cut down for campfire wood. Worked great for its size and tonnage. Tried on some larger pieces (20 inch diameter) and it would stall but I expected that. Easy to use but would be nice if it was one handed operation. Overall very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: David E Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Wen is quality
customer_reviews.text: Wen is quality, I have been watching log splitters for about 2 years now, and pulled the trigger on this little jewel for its name, and price point. The stand alone goes for appx $45. I swear they are giving this thing away, at $227. Great Splitter at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Oliver Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy one of these electric splitters as almost everyone says they are slow and the gas ones are the best. Well, that might be true, but this splitter works very well for me around the house. It's faster than I am, easy to move around with the handy stand with wheels, is built very sturdily, and has plenty of power for everything I have thrown at it. If I'm going to nitpick, I do not like the two hand operation, but I think that just comes with the territory. I honestly couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I just finished splitting and stacking 3 cord of various hardwood using the WEN 56207. I am impressed with the performance of the tool and pleased with the value (particularly vs a gas splitter). My only issue is the small hard plastic wheels make the splitter difficult to maneuver and seem like a cheapo afterthought. If anyone has found suitable replacement tires/wheels, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin St George

customer_reviews.title: shipping caused damage
customer_reviews.text: shipping caused multiple damage to log splitter. bent tray broken paint because of bend, housing where electrical electric parts are found is broken.Dont want to have shipped back .box was damaged even heavy foam protective pieces were busted up. I have pictures. shippers ought to pay.i wouid like a discount and just keep unit.it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Terry G.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my new Toy..the WEN LOG SPLITTER
customer_reviews.text: I really love this WEN log splitter. This is actually a lot of fun splitting wood. There are no disappointments here..just wish I had purchased this year's ago. If you are thinking about purchasing a log splitter you can't go wrong with this WEN log splitter. Came with the stand to elevate it up to a comfortable work height..a must have...I split some logs before mounting it on the stand so as to make sure it worked properly and it did..but without the stand it is a back killer on this 76 yr old guy. GET THE STAND for sure....so so Happy...Amazon purchase..Delivery...Quality...Price...ALL IS GOOD !
customer_reviews.author: Roy Whatley

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little machine
customer_reviews.text: Small and powerful unit. Great for small jobs. I'm using for fire pit supply. Cuts oak no problem as long as no knots. Cycle time is pretty good. Easily use the stopper for smaller pieces. The stand is a welcome addition. Overall great!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this log splitter for my husband for his birthday. First of all, I have to say that the delivery was free and quick which is huge in my review of this product. The log splitter is very hearty and strong and I'm happy to say that my husband absolutely loves it. He's been using almost every day to keep up with the firewood. Thanks for such a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Linda DiGiandomenico

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I buy a cord or two of wood every year and they always deliver several rounds that are just too big for my camping fire ring. I decided to buy the Wen 56207 and man am I sure glad I did. I used it this past Saturday for the first time and it worked flawlessly for several hours. Would recommend to anyone needing to do small to medium amounts of splitting up to 10” rounds.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hodson

customer_reviews.title: Price to performance makes this a must buy
customer_reviews.text: This splits as well as I expected. Don’t buy this thinking it will split every piece of wood. It is a small splitter for small to mid sized wood. For the money you can’t beat it. I love the stand. It’s a back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald D. Zuber II

customer_reviews.title: No more sore elbow splitting wood with an axe
customer_reviews.text: For the money, you can't beat it. It works great and I've been using it for a week and very satisfied. Plenty of power. Just don't stand in front of the unit (where the wedge is) as some firewood tends to shoot out from the end.
customer_reviews.author: hollajamer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The splitter works great! My only issue is that it takes 2 hands to operate. I know its a safety feature but it's a feature that I can do without! It arrived with a dented leg stand but the company sent me a new one free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: kenneth gurian

customer_reviews.title: Electric Warrior
customer_reviews.text: Electric log splitter arrived in two days; what a world we live in. Splitter is an absolute warrior. Assembly of the stand was quick and easy, plugged in with a 12/3 drop cord and I was splitting. Going through a 12’ dump bed of very knotty oak on day 1 and the machine never hesitated. The power is amazing and tore through many gnarly pieces of oak. I can’t believe how great a machine this is for under $300. Great job WEN! Go get one, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Value for the dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a WEN gravel compactor and their pressure washer about a year ago, and they worked perfectly. I was looking for a quiet, easy to use log splitter and decided to take the plunge with this WEN unit. I'm glad I did. It was easy to set up and works perfectly. Unlike some, it has sturdy legs to bring it up to a useable height. I would definately reccomend it to anyone who wants a well made unit. No fuss with gas and the noise associated with it. It won't make you a logger but at 80 years old I'm beyond that.
customer_reviews.author: Norton F.

customer_reviews.title: Buy another product...not this one.
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't worked since we purchased it. They sent us the parts that didn't work and those don't work. Only purchase this if you know how to replace non-working parts and have oodles of time to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Diva D

customer_reviews.title: Portable Power
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I can say at this point is. I wish the final spacing between the wedge and the ram was a bit closer. Otherwise, it has more than a enougn power,and is ideal for splitting by the wood pile.
customer_reviews.author: The Gal

customer_reviews.title: Good electric splitter.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this equipment for over a month now splitting wood. It's works great and meets all expectations. I rated it only 3 stars on maneuverability because of it's weight - about 100 pounds. I knew this going in but I'm cautious moving it around as I don't want it to fall. Also, checking the oil level is difficult because tipping the machine is necessary. Otherwise, it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Dick in Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This this is actually pretty nice. We already split a ton of wood with it and works great. For the price I was expecting something to go wrong with it the first day. But it split even the hard to split junk wood. Oak and maple wood no problem. Nice and quiet to run. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Steven J Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works awesome, just for only a couple hours, no real long term yet. Only downside is that it stops 6-8” from the wedge, which is understandable for safety. I’d like it to go a little farther. Great value, perfect for the money, does exactly what I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Kornegay

customer_reviews.title: So far, so GOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice splitter. We have it set up and split the wood as we need it. It's working great. I am wondering why it took me so many years to buy a log splitter, HA! It has plenty of power for the wood we burn: larch, pine, etc. We don't have access to hardwoods like oak, so I cannot comment on them.
customer_reviews.author: mrsmyke

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value for any price.
customer_reviews.text: this electric log splitter amazed me! It's split seasoned and green oak logs up to 12 in diameter with no problem! Was pleasantly surprised. Very maneuverable. Lot less hassle than big lot more expensive gas powered units. Would highly recommend it. Have split at least three cords of wood with it with no problem. Put it together myself even though it says use two people. I'm a little bit stronger than your average person so I guess that helps. Would buy another one if I needed it but hopefully we won't need one for a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Rdnk jeff

customer_reviews.title: Sit and Split
customer_reviews.text: Been using this splitter for a month or so and I love it. I’m disabled and have to use a walker or electric scooter to get around and I do a lot of BBQing and smoking with wood, this splitter is the prefect hight for me to sit and split logs and it’s so easy!
customer_reviews.author: GTG357

customer_reviews.title: It's less strenuous than using an axe, but not a ton faster
customer_reviews.text: This unit gets the job done. It is heavier, less maneuverable, slower, and not as sturdy on less-than-perfectly-flat surfaces (ie: if you are splitting near the downed tree) than I expected. But it sure beats swinging an axe.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Identical to what I bought from Home Depot. Works the same. Make sure to use that pressure release screw. I didn’t with the first one I got from Home Depot and it damaged the motor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thomsen

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding addition to winter wood preparation
customer_reviews.text: For someone who has split wood with an axe, when preparing for winters over the past 30 years, did extensive research and bought this item to give it a try. LOVE IT and it’s ease of use and feeling fresh after an afternoon of firewood prep.
customer_reviews.author: kinnamp

customer_reviews.title: Good splitter.
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. It came with a damaged part but I contacted the manufacturer and they sent out the replacement part right away. This splitter works great on Small to medium/large sized logs. It’s fair efficient for someone that’s not in a big hurry to split a bunch of wood like me.
customer_reviews.author: clint

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: U have to cut your logs perfect to use this machine. Other wise they will fall off machine and u use two hands to operate so plan on picking up logs a lot. Also the really dry logs it split good the green logs it would even try. I wish I didn’t spend my money on this crappy machine. Not sure if I could send back when I got it the box was all tore up and the ups driver was complaining about how heavy it was.
customer_reviews.author: street

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried about this purchase but I have had some decent sized logs stacking up in my yard. I have yet to set up the stand because the instructions are terrible. Also I don’t have an Allen wrench big enough for the dip stick. You almost have to disassemble it in order to get the handle installed as well. But you know what? At the end of the day it split the logs like I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas E.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I love that I don't have to bend over to run the spilter. When your spiltjng a cord or to it hard in your lower back. Has lot of torque can splitter the log with big knots. I the manual it tell you it's a two man operation. But I have have a few logs shot out over 6 feet. Glad I was running on my owe.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Bryars

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband, we needed a log splitter, so far he has been able to break up approx 3 cords of wood that varied in size around between 10 to 24 inches wide with no problem.! Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Functionally Effective
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived quickly and free of defects. The stand is easy to configure, and I do recommend a friend as its a little heavy for one person but doable. Ive run 2 1/2 cords through the splitter a mix of red oak, poplar, english walnut, and pine. All of it was green and split with ease. The largest round Ive put on it was likely close to 48" in circumference. So far Im very happy with it but only gave it an overall score of 4 stars because I still need to see that it stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Geremey Engle

customer_reviews.title: Nice product,  easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was some minor damage to the splitter from shipping. Box was trashed and a few dents and had to do a bit of hammering to get a leg installed due to damage. Splitter is good for the money and has done well on some good sized oak wood. For the little bit of use I think I'll use it, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works great; have not met a log it couldn't split, yet...
customer_reviews.text: My second electric wood splitter. We have solar panels so, I buy electric powered items when possible. Splits wood well and is nice and quiet! 2-foot diameter pondorosa pine rounds challenged it but, with a few tries, I got them all split. I've used it with pine, cedar, madrone, oak, and birch.
customer_reviews.author: Firefly Becky

customer_reviews.title: Wen log splitter
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Arrived with a cracked wheel, customer service had a new one out in the mail the same day. Easy to use seems like it has more than enough power. Just remember to loosen the breather screw before use. The cart let’s you work at a comfortable height.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My family loves this splitter. We have a buck stove and buy loads of wood to use to warm our family room and for the ambiance. My husband and 13 year old daughter will fight over who gets to do what, but it cuts the time down in splitting the wood to make it last longer and burn better. One of our best purchases this year.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Z

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit. A great value.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. I assembled with the stand. Tested it a it worked effortlessly. I suggest a caution sticker near the bleed valve as a reminder and emphasis of opening it prior to use. I suggest an alternative location for the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the purchase. I had about a cord of wood that was split in pieces too big for my fireplace. The WEN took care of it with zero issues. I also split up some larger logs that were about 16" and it went through them like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Robi Owens

customer_reviews.title: Feeds the campfires at the RV Park
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. This machine does a great job splitting good size logs for the fire pit. It will pay for itself by the end of next season.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was damage but product seem to be intact nothing wrong, broken, or missing. Put it together split a few logs to test it out, so far it does what it's told.
customer_reviews.author: douglas jones

customer_reviews.title: Strong machine, use care when operating.
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. Splits wood easily. Slide set screw does not hold. Beware, tough logs may be thrown off in any direction. Use care when operating. Has been useful in cutting down on splitting time.
customer_reviews.author: John Davis

product_meta.title: WEN 56207 6.5-Ton Electric Log Splitter,Black
product_meta.description: Remember when you had 13,000 pounds of log-cracking pressure all in the palm of your hands? Quickly transform logs into firewood with the WEN 6.5-Ton Electric Log-Splitter with Stand. This unit features a powerful 15-amp 2.5 horsepower motor to make easy work of logs up to 10 inches in diameter and 20.5 inches in length. Install the included stand to elevate the cradle 34 inches off of the floor or assemble the wheels directly to the body of the log splitter for a low-profile design that sits directly on the ground. Forget the hassles and expenses that come with gasoline-powered alternatives. An electric log splitter means you will never have to worry about cold starts or clogged carburetors again. With a 20-second cycle time, a 14.75-inch cylinder stroke, a 16-square-inch push plate, and a 5-inch wedge, you’ll be able to take on even the hardest of woods. Two-handed operation maximizes user safety while the fume-free design eliminates carbon monoxide and other toxic emissions. Easily transport your splitter from the shed to the forest with the onboard pull handle and the two never-flat 5.5-inch wheels. And, because it’s a WEN product, your log splitter comes backed by a two-year warranty, a nationwide network of skilled service technicians and a friendly customer help line. Remember when you had enough firewood to keep your family warm all winter? Remember WEN.
feature_bullets: Powerful 15A motor provides over 13,000 pounds of log cracking pressure
Use the log splitter with or without the 34-inch stand depending on user preferences
Included pull handle and 5.5-inch never-flat wheels make for easy transportation between jobs
Electric power means no gasoline, no carbon monoxide emissions, and limited maintenance
Split logs up to 10 inches in diameter and 20.5 inches in length

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars552 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
